Description: Oak panel bearing tempera portrait of a bearded man wearing a white tunic with purple clavi.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Kom el-Kharaba el-Kebir (Previously recorded as Rubaiyat)
Curator's comments: Published: S. Walker and M. Bierbrier, Fayum. Misteriosi volti dall'Egitto, London 1997, p. 114 [83]. D. Antoine and M. Vandenbeusch, Egyptian mummies. Exploring ancient lives, Sydney 2016, p. 178.
Bibliographic references: Parlasca & Seeman 1999 / Augenblicke. Mumienporträts und ägyptische Grabkunst aus römischer Zeit (p.170, no.70)
Cartwright and Middleton 2008 / Scientific aspects of ancient faces: mummy portraits from Egypt (p.63, table.4)
Exhibition history: 1997 22 Oct-1998 30 Apr, Italy, Rome, Fondaione Memmo, Ancient Faces 2016-2017 10 Oct-30 Apr, Sydney, Powerhouse Museum, Ancient Lives 2017 16 Jun-18 Oct, Hong Kong Science Museum, Ancient Lives 2017-2018 14 Nov-20 Feb, Taiwan, National Palace Museum, Ancient Lives 2018 16 Mar-22 Jul, Brisbane, Queensland Museum of Art, Ancient Lives 2019-2020 14 Sept- 28 Jun, Montreal, Museum of Fine Arts, Ancient Lives EXTENDED DUE TO COVID19 2020-2021, 19 Sept - 21 Mar, Toronto, Royal Ontario Museum, Ancient Lives
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir Robert Ludwig Mond
